title: Single slit - same pattern in 2 setups different f

content.question: In each of two experiments, light is incident on a narrow slit and forms a diffraction pattern on a screen located some distance from the slit. The screens in the two experiments are the same distance from the respective slits, and the two diffraction patterns have brightness minima at the same positions with respect to the central bright maximum. In Experiment <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the incident light has frequency <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and the width of the slit is <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. In Experiment <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the incident light has frequency <math alttext="2 f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. What is the width of the slit in Experiment <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?
